articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Donald Trump became the first U.S. president to be convicted of a crime on Thursday when a New York jury found him guilty of falsifying documents to cover up a payment to silence a porn star ahead of the 2016 election.
articles.title: Jury finds Donald Trump guilty on all 34 counts at hush money trial

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 12 Palestinians in a dawn airstrike on Rafah in southern Gaza on Thursday and fighting raged in several other areas of the coastal enclave, Gaza medics said.
articles.title: Israeli airstrike on Rafah kills 12 Palestinians, Gaza medics say

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Bate Felix
articles.description: First results from South Africa's most competitive election since the end of apartheid were trickling in early on Thursday, after a late voting surge kept many polling stations open with snaking queues late into the night.
articles.title: South African election results trickle in after wide-open vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas said on Thursday it had told mediators it would not take part in more negotiations during ongoing aggression but was ready for a "complete agreement" including an exchange of hostages and prisoners if Israel stopped the war.
articles.title: Hamas says it is ready for a 'complete agreement' if Israel stops war

articles.author: Steve Holland, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: President Joe Biden has quietly allowed Kyiv to fire U.S.-supplied weapons at targets inside Russia but only near the border with the area around Ukraine's northern city of Kharkiv, U.S. officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Biden allows Ukraine to use US-supplied arms to strike inside Russia near Kharkiv area, say US officials

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces shelled a five-storey apartment building in Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city, killing at least one person and injuring 13, local officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: Russian shelling kills at least one in apartment block in Ukraine's Kharkiv

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, John Davison, Emma Farge, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: The Israeli military has lifted a ban on the sale of food to Gaza from Israel and the occupied West Bank as its battlefield offensive chokes international aid, according to Palestinian officials, businessmen and international aid workers.
articles.title: Exclusive: Israel reopens Gaza food sales as Rafah raid chokes aid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico was released from a hospital in the central city of Banska Bystrica, where he had been recovering from an assassination attempt, and taken to his apartment in Bratislava on Thursday, Slovak media reported.
articles.title: Slovak Prime Minister Fico released from hospital, media says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un guided a firing drill of 600mm "super-large" multiple rocket launchers, state media KCNA reported on Friday.
articles.title: N.Korea says Kim guided multiple rocket launchers demonstration

articles.author: Jessie Pang, James Pomfret
articles.description: Fourteen Hong Kong pro-democracy activists were found guilty and two were acquitted on Thursday in a landmark subversion trial that critics say could deal another blow to the city's rule of law and its reputation as a global financial hub.
articles.title: Fourteen Hong Kong democrats found guilty in landmark subversion trial
